message_1: Find the value of x in the equation 3^x ≡ 11 (mod 17).
message_2:
To solve the equation 3^x ≡ 11 (mod 17), we will use the method of successive squaring to find the smallest positive integer x that satisfies the equation.

1. Calculate the powers of 3 modulo 17:
3^1 ≡ 3 (mod 17)
3^2 ≡ 9 (mod 17)
3^3 ≡ 27 ≡ 10 (mod 17)
3^4 ≡ 81 ≡ 13 (mod 17)
3^5 ≡ 39 ≡ 5 (mod 17)
3^6 ≡ 15 (mod 17)
3^7 ≡ 45 ≡ 11 (mod 17)

2. We found that 3^7 ≡ 11 (mod 17), so the smallest positive integer x that satisfies the equation is x = 7.
